contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Kibbutz | name = Yakhini | foundation = 1950 | founded_by = [[Yemen]]ite immigrants | region = [[Negev]] | council = [[Sha'ar HaNegev Regional Council|Sha'ar HaNegev]] | industry = | affiliation = [[Moshavim Movement]] | website = }} '''Yakhini''' ({{lang-he-n|יָכִינִי}}) is an [[Orthodox Judaism|Orthodox]] [[moshav]] in southern [[Israel]]. Located in the northern [[Negev]] desert near the town of [[Sderot]], it falls under the jurisdiction of [[Sha'ar HaNegev Regional Council]]. In 2006 it had a population of 476. The moshav was founded in 1950 by [[Jew]]ish immigrants from [[Yemen]], who were brought to Israel during [[Operation Magic Carpet (Yemen)|Operation Magic Carpet]], when most [[Yemenite Jews]] arrived in the country. The moshav is named for one of the sons of [[Simeon]], son of the patriarch [[Jacob]], as it is located in territory that belonged to the [[Tribe of Simeon]] in [[Bible|biblical]] times (Numbers 26:12). {{Sha'ar HaNegev Regional Council}} {{coord|31|29|N|34|36|E|display=title|region:IL_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki}} [[Category:Moshavim]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1950]] [[Category:Religious Israeli communities]] [[Category:Gaza envelope]]
